intro: Nepeta sudanica, commonly known as Sudan catmint, is a flowering plant native to the Sudan region of Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square, hairy stems and opposite leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its flowers are small, blue to purple in hue, and clustered in whorls along the stems. Nepeta sudanica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild aromatic properties.
